entity.name: The Big Life Fix with Simon Reeve
entity.description: Simon Reeve presents this three-part documentary exploring how science can transform lives. The series brings together a group of designers, engineers, programmers and technology professionals to take part in an extraordinary challenge. Thousands of people in Britain are struggling to perform daily tasks due to illnesses or physical disabilities, here to help individuals find a solution to their problems is the team of experts. Using their ingenuity and key skills the group creates new inventions, using cutting-edge technology, to aid people in need.

tweets.text:
As hosts of #COP26, we're committed to protecting and restoring our natural environment.

We're working #TogetherForOurPlanet with @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm and others to deliver the Nature Recovery Network and create better connected spaces for nature 🌿 https://t.co/8WXeqhXwOQ

We received this video from a member of the public who lives at a marina on the great #Ouse

We have a couple of theories about what we think is in the water🤔. Let us know what you think they are.

Please share and reply so we can solve this mystery! https://t.co/AUwcWphPOp

Shame on u @thameswater ! This is the 10th time untreated sewage has sept into our garden in 6 mths (ongoing for 48 hrs already). U put the H&S of my family at risk -  filth carrying COVID. You deny responsibility and don’t send any1 to fix it. @ThreeRiversHSC @Ofwat @EnvAgency https://t.co/sXgTlgf8ti

tweets.text: Road runoff; a topic of great interest to the #RiverVer that seems all too easy to ignore @EnvAgencySE @HighwaysEngland https://t.co/12ri1r6V4X
Great work by @EnvAgencyYNE and the local councils to construct these schemes all around Hull and surrounding villages. https://t.co/N1Ft0f3qTw
@frogsatuea @JoP24048538 @Donna_Dean @EnvAgencyAnglia @eelsaregood @jonahtosney @harrietalvis I can see better now..yes, not eels. Too long and uniform. Gutted.
@HQReviews Just for clarity, the Environment Agency have been responsible for all of the work on the fish passes. I will pass your comment on to them.

@WhitbyNats @YorksWildlife @NewtPartnership @Fr_RowntreePark @northyorkmoors @RyedaleDC @ScarboroCouncil @RaincliffeWoods @YorkCountyParks @DalbyFriends @StNicksFields @EnvAgencyYNE Thanks for the interest! Have sent you some details 👍

Dumping on #ValentinesDay (or any other) could lead to a crushing experience when you are caught for fly-tipping. You'll face a criminal sentence, large fine and your vehicle could be seized #LoveYourEnvironment https://t.co/psaHsMQedX

tweets.text: @tinaonions @SilebyPC @MountsorrelPar1 @needham_laurie @liz_m_bee @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @LeicsCountyHall @CharnwoodBC @CharnwoodPolice @LR4x4Response @FloodDigitalEA @ATCLeicester @rothleyweather #RiverScene FLOOD WARNING ⚠️ now in force by @EnvAgencyMids affecting #Blaby , #GlenParva, #GreatGken and #CrowMills South Wigston#carsnotboats.

A rare work trip north of the wall doing auto raingauge inspections at Coalburn and Crew Fell. Every 3 years formal @metoffice inspections assess the gauge and the site to ensure they are fit for purpose, eg not becoming oversheltered with trees. Both sites passed the test 👍 https://t.co/MgM9XSD03U

The law is clear that in these cases it is the landowners responsibility to clear a fly tip but many councils don’t support evidence gathering and pursuing culprits on private land which is unfair. https://t.co/3saCsaIwGD

Better late than never, updated monthly and rolling 12 month rainfall for selected @EnvAgencyNW #Cumbria raingauges. A dry start to January before a wet middle and #stormchristoph. Noticeably wetter than average around the coast, more like average inland. @metoffice 🌨️☔️ https://t.co/hFsVsZEr9S

@greenbeltsal @EnvAgency @Owlthorpefields @FriendsLoxley @saveferriby2020 @no_expressway @Hs2Rebellion & prosecuting landowners who pollute rivers @bilgribs "The Environment Agency has documented 243 violations of the “farming rules for water” since they came into effect in April 2018," step up please & enforce the law 👍 https://t.co/CpCrToYj47

urls.title: Revealed: no penalties issued under 'useless' English farm pollution laws | Farming | The Guardian
urls.description: Exclusive: Environment Agency has failed to prosecute or fine any of 243 documented violations since 2018

tweets.text:
Ran past the #flood alleviation scheme in Cottingham this morning and it was great to see it working to its full potential.
This is protecting hundreds of houses in both Cottingham and Hull.
Good to see lots of #wildfowl using it at the other end as well. https://t.co/VoIBpiUDhq

Did they really think a bit of mastic was going to hold strips of rubber in place in the seams of the new £80m Dawlish Sea wall. This is outrageous. They should be prosecuted for the pollution they have caused. Masses of rubber & gum now in the sea! #Devon @Devonlive @EnvAgency https://t.co/ezJigKSAPP

@ursula_juta @JoP24048538 @Donna_Dean @EnvAgencyAnglia @eelsaregood @jonahtosney @harrietalvis Ice melting slowly, moved by the current & the wind, leaving a sinking plume of relatively cold and clear water behind. 100% not eels, snakes or lampreys

More info on the scheme visit ➡️https://t.co/7KEtNXTu4V https://t.co/OfnhF7M7rS

We’ve set the ambitious goal of becoming a net zero organisation by 2030.

We’ve already reduced our direct emissions by 47%, but we're planning to cut emissions even further by innovating and driving down emissions with our supply chain.

#TogetherForOurPlanet  #ShowTheLove https://t.co/GsO73RfP2r

@JoP24048538 @Donna_Dean @EnvAgencyAnglia @eelsaregood Ohh wow! Got to be, hasn't it? I'm only on a tiny phone screen so grainy but what else would it be? 
@jonahtosney @harrietalvis What are your thoughts?

Londoners finally get the idea that our rivers are full of sewage and it's just not worth it.

https://t.co/1s8qOB5NSi

tweets.text: Meet Bill, a proud operator of one of the biggest mobile pumps in the country. This serious kit can shift an Olympic pool of floodwater in 25 mins! A vital part of our national stock that we deploy around the country wherever it’s needed #floodaware #winterready https://t.co/q0xtgPXm3v

@Feargal_Sharkey The Thames has untreated sewage poured into it regularly, yet our children have to travel to school like this, wading thru it as it floods the towpath, because politicians argue over fixing #HammersmithBridge Truly shameful. https://t.co/GNEbLedwJH

tweets.text:
#Hertfordshire 
14.2.21 Defra Sandy monitor covering #Herts & #Beds has had no data available for PM2.5 #AirPollution for 39 days so far this year! 
It is now not measuring, please advise why?  @EnvAgency 
@DefraGovUK 
#AirPollution #AQMonitoring #Health https://t.co/BoNwieohEm
@Donna_Dean @EnvAgencyAnglia I can't think what else they'd be ... do @ursula_juta and @eelsaregood have any other thoughts?
@EnvAgencyAnglia Could they be Eels?

Pollution control expert Jo Bradley explores the challenges of poisoning road runoff & the solutions. Its payload of microplastic tyre wear particles & heavy metals damage our #chalkstreams & rivers. Book your FREE place. Wed 24 Feb, all welcome. https://t.co/0fSAOMpNC9 https://t.co/9S53vfpnZz

Today is International Day of Women in Science.Join us in saying thank you to our #WomenInScience working on the front line to:

🏘️ protect homes and businesses from flooding
🌅 care for our environment
🌳 tackle climate change
 🔬detect #COVID19 in waste water https://t.co/LMX96LmzuO

tweets.text:
2 days to go…

The #Kendal Flood Risk Management scheme will be built in small sections to minimise disruption to residents and the environment. 

Details about the works can be found ➡️ https://t.co/G0OazNDMvh https://t.co/PjCj52oqwh

We have transformed a 0.5km stretch of the River Ash to provide new habitats for fish, invertebrates and waterfowl to thrive; with benefits for human visitors too. Thanks to our partners @SpelthorneBC @EnvAgency & Spelthorne Nat His Soc 
https://t.co/Kkijkr2SKo https://t.co/9iHjmiFjxz

Don’t accept unwanted gifts for #ValentinesDay

If you are approached to store waste for someone else, discover waste on your land, or you suspect this is going on, report it immediately to us on 0800 80 70 60 or anonymously to Crimestoppers 0800 555 111 

#LoveYourEnvironment https://t.co/dIag2ptmZl

tweets.text: I won’t pretend to know anything about cyber security but I find it quite remarkable that @ScottishEPA river levels are still unavailable after a "significant cyber attack" almost 2 months ago. This information is so valuable to so many. Anybody tried holding control-alt-delete?
